name: Steigenberger Airport Hotel Amsterdam

reviews.text: The Dorint was a nice surprise. Helpful staff, clean, regular and free shuttle service to and from the airport every 1/2 hour, good food in their restaurants, the breaksfast buffet really complete with juices, cereals, cheese, breads, cold meat, eggs ( easy over, scrambled and sunday morning ...as you like), a working desk and free cable internet, not WIFI but nothing is perfect and yes, soundproof. No noise from the corridor and no noise from outside.But if you prefer to open your window for fresh air, you can.
reviews.title: A train away from Amsterdam..but close to the airport
Europe highlight 18 days
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel probably even if you are not on a business trip. Amsterdam can be reach easily by train from the airport ( where you get to with the hotel shuttle).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location at Schiphol airport, modern interior with great lay out, nice n comfort bedroom, staff helpful n pollite, nice lobby
reviews.title: You will be back.

reviews.text: Despite being residents of the Netherlands and living very near Schiphol, we recently escaped to the Dorint hotel for one night to avoid a wild local festival. We wanted a good night’s sleep before a long transatlantic flight the next morning, and we weren’t disappointed. Among the many highlights of this hotel, we didn’t hear a single plane all night and slept like babies.
reviews.title: OK hotel but a long way from the airport.

reviews.text: The hotel is modern in its décor and offers free parking (with pink painted “Ladies Parking” spots available in front) and also a free shuttle to and from the airport. The bar is open 24 hours a day and a beautiful spa and workout facility – complete with a pool – is available for guests. Free breakfast is included with some room deals. Wireless internet is available on the ground floor and in the rooms via broadband.
reviews.title: Good hotel near the airport

reviews.text: I just stayed overnight to catch an early morning flight and didn't use the restaurant etc. I needed a good night's sleep and certainly got that. The room was first class - a good size, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, aircon/heating easily adjustable to individual needs, bathroom spotless and modern.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: The free shuttle bus to and from the airport terminal is every 30 minutes, journey time about 10 minutes. It's a dedicated bus so doesn't stop at other hotels. It's a large bus with easy access to get your luggage on and off.
reviews.title: Good quality Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's quite chaotic at the hotel transfer bus stop, too many people and buses for the space available, but this affects all transfer buses, not just the one for the Sofitel.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

likes.liked: — Comfort and convenience for the aiport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Am currently spending quite a bit of time in Amsterdam and as I am working in Amstelveen it is easier to stay nearer to work than head all of the way into Amsterdam. I generally dont think the standard of hotels in Amsterdam is great and if working there, tend to stay in the Hilton. But to avoid the longer journey, I have chosen to stay here every week now for a few weeks. And I have to say the quality of this hotel is really good. Rooms are clean, everything is open and spacious....good internet connection: though a bit pricey at €19 at night.... overall a very good business hotel...free shuttle also from the airport. Wouldnt be too keen on staying here if holidaying in amsterdam (costs €25 taxi from hilton) but fine if you want to be near airport. Food is a bit boring but then again that is only if you spend 20 nights in 1 month there...one thing: €23 for breakfast is a bit spicey. Be aware there is nothing around this area so can be very boring and if there for lesure best to head into town for accommodation. There is a nice walk in Amsterdamsebos (wooded area) near the hotel and the hotel give bikes out for free...and you can also get some nice restaurants in nearby Amstelveen. Note it is built near the original airport and now the area for provate planes etc...but I have not experienced any noise disruption there. Good hotel in all...but time for a change I think...for me at least
reviews.title: Nice twin towers

reviews.text: We spent two nights, approx one week apart, at the Dorint Sofitel Amsterdam Airport as part of our honeymoon. We booked through the hotel's website which was easy to use. We took a "hot deal" which means you pay immediately and if you cancel you don't get a refund. We subsequently emailed the hotel to check that we would be given non-smoking rooms and received a prompt, friendly and helpful response.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: I needed a place to stay overnight and Accor hotels had a reservation desk in the Airport. I got one room at thier new hotel for 120 Euro including shuttle transportation to and from the airport/hotel. This was closer, newer and cheaper then the Courtyard by Marriott by over 50 Euro.
reviews.title: Nice Bed!!!
Modern, business-oriented hotel
reviews.text: It is a lovely hotel and the new shows. The beds were beautiful and the room minimalist modern decor. 1 thing that slightly irritated me is no bell service, but the room service was great and they have lots of in room treats including great bathroom ammenities and in room internet. But the pillows, linen and bed..... ahhh lovely.

Most of the clientel appeared to be business people and the outside of the hotel is kind of ugly office building like and not very pretty. But once inside it is very nice! This would NOT be a good location for visiting the city center - too far away.
reviews.title: Superb hotel
Great Business Alternative near the Airport
reviews.text: They have a health center included a sauna, sanarium and turkish steam bath. Very nice.
Located next to Schipol Airport, this hotel is perfect for the business traveler. In addition, we had a great rate for a single night's stay.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: I had an executive room and could not have been happier. The bed was perfect, the room layout superb, and the heated floors in the toilet to die for when it is cold outside.
reviews.title: If in Transient stay at the Dorint

reviews.text: After my stay in Aberdeen this was dying and going to heaven.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay for your businesstrips

reviews.text: Would I stay again..YES. I have stayed at the airport Hilton and Sheraton and this leaves both of those hotels for dead!
reviews.title: Pleasurable Experience

reviews.text: Good service, nice staff, good place to be. The restaurants serve excellent food and the bar is a cosy place to spend some time.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are really profesional and friendly. Amenities are really superb. Will definitely enjoy staying again.
reviews.title: Expect more
formerly Dorint Sofitel Amsterdam Airport, now just "Dorint Hotel".
reviews.text: I spent my last full night here (after a few days at the Rookies-Uptown Hotel which was excellent, and some time in Brussels). At under 90 Euro this was a luxurious BARGAIN.
From the airport follow the signs to "Hotel Buses". The Dorint has a large bus circling between the hotel and the Airport every 30 minutes. The ride takes about 8 minutes.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but inconvenient location for city centre

likes.liked: — Good quality rooms and amenities within the hotel
likes.disliked: — Location in relation to city centre, and inconvenient transport to get to city centre.

reviews.text: The train from the airport to central Amsterdam for day trips, cost's around EU$3.60 one way or EU$6.20 return and takes about 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Very Very Rude Staff

reviews.text: Good business hotel with well equipped rooms. Mine had a view which encapsulated a bridge over a canal, a road (which goes very quiet at night), and a large commercial building.
reviews.title: Abysmal service

reviews.text: VERY comfortable bed, luxurious pillows and linen. Fully equipped bathroom, with shower and bath. The safe operates on the swipe of any credit card, but I couldn't get it to work properly, so didn't bother with it.
reviews.title: An Amazing Nights Sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful most of the times. That been said, we had a couple of staff treat us with that very familiar Dutch manner. Also, be aware to put the “Do Not Disturb” sign on the door as seems the staff don’t understand the concept of a lie in (we were woken up 4 times when we didn’t, first one at 8.15am!)
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel

reviews.text: There is a free shuttle that runs all day, every half hour, from Schiphol to Dorint and back. Just walk to the right as you come out of the airport until you find the stop with all the hotel shuttle timetables. It takes 10mins to/from Schiphol from/to Dorint and another 15mins from/to the city centre to/from Schiphol by train and the trains leave every 10mins during the day. Less often during the night. There is also a paid shuttle to the city centre twice a day.
reviews.title: An awesome airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has gym facilities, sauna and pool and it also offers massages and treatments. I cannot comment on any as we didn’t use them. We also didn’t use the free bikes offered but if you are going to the city centre make sure you do! You are much safer on a bike in Amsterdam than on foot, even if you are a novice rider.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel close to airport!

reviews.text: The room was big enough with good facilities, smartly incorporated in the room. Modern furnishings, comfortable bed and very good natural and artificial lighting. The blackout curtains did a very good job blocking the light out. The internet access was by cable only in our room (the cable is only long enough to place the laptop on the desk near it so if you want more bring your own cable) but it was fast and reliable. The bathroom, a good size, featured a heated mirror (so it didn’t steam) which I thought was very helpful. The room also had a dividing sliding door between the main room and bathroom/hallway area. I found this really convenient as I didn’t have to wake my partner up to get ready in the morning.
reviews.title: Great experience despite not being downtown

reviews.text: We booked through Expedia and got a great price but we saw on the door that the normal price was €300 per night which I thought that was a bit excessive, especially if you think that they also charge for parking €8,50 per day which I thought was bit cheeky. You can park across the street for free during the weekends but not during the week as it is reserved for badge holders only.
reviews.title: Many amenities, well suited for business travellers...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just needed a place near AMS to spend a night between flight connections. We chose the Dorint because of the price, the free shuttle, and the reviews on TA. It was better than we expected.
reviews.title: Great spot for a stop over

reviews.text: Very efficient room with all necessary amenities except no wifi (wired in-room internet is available for free, or wifi in the lobby areas). Comfortable bed; silent room; good linens. Excellent, prompt shuttle every 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Slightly above average business hotel - will do for a stopover but service is so-so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in/out was efficient. Staff was helpful. Three dining options (and, as the hotel it located far from other services, that's important). Excellent breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Good, but disappointing food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not a destination hotel nor the best place in Amsterdam, but for our needs, it was perfect.
reviews.title: Clean and pleasant!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Dorint when arriving late to Schiphol. The hotel is reasonable close to Schiphol and the free shuttle bus runs every 30 minutes even in the evenings ((usually stay at the Marriott but in the evenings their shuttle only run every hour so therefore decided to try the Dorint). The bus was on time and also large enough to bring all guests (saw some other hotel shuttles where people were almost fighting to get a seat).
reviews.title: For me, it's all about the free bicycles

reviews.text: A good and modern hotel for a layover at the airport or as I stayed, for a 2 day conference.
reviews.title: A good Hotel at Schipol

reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable and have all the needs for a short stay. Tea and coffee making in the room and iron and ironing board. Good buffet breakfast and other meals also well catered for.
reviews.title: Good for an airport hotel.

reviews.text: The conferencing suite was very efficient and things just worked
reviews.title: Great airport hotel
Top Notch airport hotel
reviews.text: I will stay again.

After staying at the Dorint for one night, I would say that it is a pretty good hotel, and is very handy for those who have layovers or are in Amsterdam for a short time. We booked a triple room, and I pleasantly surprised that they brought in an actual bed for the third bed, rather than a pull out couch like other hotels I have experienced. The rooms were modern and comfortable and had some nice touches like heated tiles in the bathroom which were great during winter.
reviews.title: It's quite good but....

description: The Steigenberger Airport Hotel is a first class business hotel with a wide range of recreational facilities. The good accessibility thanks to the free shuttle service to and from the international railway station and Amsterdam Schiphol Airport and direct access to the A4 and A9 motorways, makes Steigenberger Airport Hotel Amsterdam the perfect location for your accommodation, meeting or event.Starting on January 1st 2014, the usage of the WLAN will be free of charge for guests of all hotels of the Steigenberger Hotels AG.
